definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Movie-goer Fatima seems to share his view.
sentences.chinese: 前去观看影片的法蒂玛与他有同感。

sentences.english: This town is for Georgians as Fátima is for Portuguese.
sentences.chinese: 这个镇为格鲁吉亚法蒂玛是为葡萄牙语。

sentences.english: The Fatimid State in Egypt was on the verge of total disintegration in the period before Saladin's arrival.
sentences.chinese: 埃及的法蒂玛王朝在萨拉丁到来前濒于完全崩溃。

sentences.english: The door opened: Blue Beard caught Fatima’s arm.
sentences.chinese: 门打开了，蓝胡子抓住法蒂玛的胳膊。

sentences.english: When Blue Beard was away, all Fatima’s friends came to see her.
sentences.chinese: 当蓝胡子不在家时，法蒂玛的所有朋友都来看她。

definition: Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
Ayshe, Aise or Ayesha (name)/Aishah bint Abi Bakr (c. 614-678), youngest wife of prophet Mohamed 穆罕默德[Mu4 han3 mo4 de2]
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Suleiman (name)/General Michel Suleiman (1948-), Lebanese military man and politician, president of Lebanon 2008-2014
Nasr or Nasser (Arab name)/Gamal Abdel Nasser (1918-1970), Egyptian President
Safi (Moroccan city on the Atlantic coast)
